data.title: Great Food
data.text: We actually ate here twice- food was great. Service was fast, friendly. Nice outdoor dining however do not sit on the street side- buses come by-noise and smoke. The veggie burger was perfect!

data.title: Food was tasty and service good
data.text: My server was very attentive and the food was delicious, I decided I wanted to try a variety of items so just had 3 different appetizers and they were all delicious.

data.title: Slowest service ever
data.text: The food here was decent for a chain restaurant, but the service was incredibly slow.  Went here for lunch and would not go back if there is a time limit.  The restaurant was not that busy for lunch and it was almost 90 minutes from being seated to paying the check.

data.title: Meh
data.text: The food was nothing special.  The French dip sliders were pretty good but the chips were inedible.  The beer was ok.  The only bright spot was our server who was excellent.

data.title: Perfect steak - perfect service
data.text: Sat outside and watched people walk by on the sidewalk.  The food, atmosphere, and service were excellent.  Had a great menu with multiple options.  I had the ribeye steak which was perfect and a craft brew which was also excellent.  The service could not have been better.

data.title: Reasonable price and great service
data.text: Had a fantastic dinner. Some homemade potato chips with sauce and figs as well as some in house brewed beer. Reasonable price and great service!

data.title: Great beer
data.text: We stumped upon this place while checking our Fourth Street.  Unfortunately the restaurant was overrun by two conventions that the staff said put them behind on seating. It took about an hour to get a table but the staff, while taxed, did their best to make the time pass quickly.  Once we sat, the food was good and reasonable.

data.title: Nice Location
data.text: Went there for dinner.  Got the Chicken Schnitzel.  Good service from a friendly waitress.  The meal was good.  Many beers were available, but I just had water.

data.title: It's All About the Beer..the Food, Not So Much
data.text: We made our second visit to GB last night but it was the first time we ate. As we were waiting to be seated in a line of only 3 people, some guy cuts the line, waltzes right up to the hostess and to my shock she seats him! We got a great table outside so all was well. During both visits we greatly enjoyed the microbrews on draft. The food however was only ok. If there was any lobster in my shrimp and lobster tacos it was too minuscule to be noticed. The sauce was tasty but the filling rather skimpy. They were served in not one but two taco shells (1 hard, 1 soft) which I found unnecessary. Both shells were cold and flavorless and most likely store bought. My spouse fared better with the Kobe burger which was ordered medium but arrived well done. It was still quite tasty and good sized but again too much bun. The garlic fries that accompanied both dishes were hot, crispy and delicious. Go for the beer! If you eat- keep it simple.

data.title: Dinner with friends
data.text: The food is wonderful here. My husband and I got the gorgonzola steak. It was cooked to perfection and the sides were wonderful as well. Everyone at the table raved about their food.

data.title: Just Ok.
data.text: My had lunch at GB Brewery with several co-workers on a business trip.  The location was appealing because we weren't familiar with Louisville and stumbled upon it while at 4th Street Live.  They have outside seating which was a nice option but the chairs were covered in bird poop.  The food was okay.  The beer was good.  Our server was excellent.  She was super nice and talkative.

data.title: Nice Place
data.text:
The menu has a wide range of food and prices.  I had the Chicken Bruschetta which was very good.  It was quite a large serving.  Everyone else in my party seemed to enjoy their food.  

The children's menu had mac n cheese.  My daughter asked if it was Kraft mac n cheese as one of her daughters does not like it and she doesn't like to pat $6-$7 for Kraft mac n cheese.  She was told that it was not Kraft mac n cheese and that it was made at the restaurant.  Well, we were all pretty sure it was Kraft mac cheese.  It looked exactly like it and tasted exactly like it.  So that meal went to waste.

Other than that, we enjoyed it.

data.title: Great Friday Night Dinner
data.text: Enjoyed dinner on the patio. Staff was super friendly, server was attentive and knowledgeable. Mushroom risotto fritters were ok but nothing special. Steak was perfectly cooked. Chicken Schnitzel was yummy. Spaetzel and mushrooms was pretty bland but was saved by a little salt and lemon. Overall we were pleased and will definitely be back.

data.title: Over priced and unimpressive
data.text: Nice location at 4th Street. Service was polite but generally slow and not really engaged or attentive. Beer was mediocre. I also had a cocktail that i didn't finish. It was over priced for the quality of the food but it was served fast. I had the lobster & shrimp mac and cheese. While it had a good flavor it was way too salty and barely warm. My husband got the sausage meal and said they were the worst brats he's had at a restaurant. Overall we were not impressed and will not be back.

data.title: Smoke Discrimination
data.text: We called ahead to see if a friend could enjoy smoking on the outside patio.  We arrived about 3:00 pm and were the ONLY customers outside.  There are two outside patios since the restaurant is on a corner. However, as soon as $20 cigars were lit, we were asked to leave.  We said "but no one else is here". The server reported he did not make the 'no cigar' smoking policy only enforced it.  Very disappointing but we were able to sit outside a few doors down at a sports bar.

data.title: Avoid them on Friday night
data.text: I never do this, but this review is at the table 75 minutes after sitting down and our food has not arrived. One of our party got a burger but it was not right. I love GB in New Orleans so I had high hopes for Louisville. The seem disorganized. I was told they were out of something but the table that came in well after us got what I was told was out. Hmmmm. Hope the food is good eventually. Lots of other good options at Fourth Street Live, go try them.

data.title: Good food, good service, once seated
data.text: We arrived for dinner to a half full restaurant and found the wait to be over 20 minutes.  Empty tables littered the view from the hostess stand.  Never got a clear understanding as to why the long delay.  We stood in the bar waiting where I asked the bartender if the bar tables were open seating.  She shared they were so we sat down.  The waitress came over sharing that there would still be a wait for service.  I told her the bartender told us it was open seating so what gives?  She was standing there and could take an order.  What appeared to be a challenge suddenly changed into a better situation as she changed her countenance and we had a great dinner.  Food was good, and the service got much better.

data.title: Just OK....
data.text: I visited this restaurant with 2 colleagues from work when in Louisville for a conference.  We were seated right away, in a booth, towards the back of the restaurant.  We ordered an appetizer, Blue Crab & Artichoke Dip.  It was awful!  I personally don't eat seafood but my colleagues just took a couple bites and let it sit.  We ordered a vegetable to use to dip and was served carrots.  She couldn't eat those either because it seemed that they were dipped in a vinegar or some kind of liquid. I ordered the 12oz ribeye, well-done, and had to send it back because it was medium rare at best.  The garlic mashed potatoes did taste good. My friend ordered the salmon and did enjoy that dish.  The service was not that good either.  The waiter made no suggestions and we felt we were an inconvenience.   I do not plan on visiting this restaurant again.

data.title: Always a great meal
data.text: I ate here with a colleague for lunch.  The food is not your typical bar fare.  Service is quick at lunchtime too.

data.title: Good food ..good service
data.text: Food was amazing and service was amazing the only thing keeping it from being perfect was that they were out of certain things....a restaurant should never be out of things on the menu.
